Trump says he doesn't need concerts after Megan Thee Stallion 'twerks' at Kamala Harris rally
content: ​MAGA prudes are angry with Megan Thee Stallion's performance at Kamala Harris' fundraiser in Atlanta as they denigrated Kamala Harris as a non-serious contestant requiring Megan to twerk on the stage for votes. ​"Crazy Kamala Harris, voted the WORST Vice President in American history, needed a concert to bring people into the Atlanta arena, and they started leaving 5 minutes into her speech. I don’t need concerts or entertainers, I just have to MAKE AMERICA GREAT AGAIN!!!" Trump posted on Truth Social.
summary: ​MAGA prudes are angry with Megan Thee Stallion's performance at Kamala Harris' fundraiser in Atlanta as they denigrated Kamala Harris as a non-serious contestant requiring Megan to twerk on the stage for votes. ​"Crazy Kamala Harris, voted the WORST Vice President in American history, needed a concert to bring people into the Atlanta arena, and they started leaving 5 minutes into her speech. I don’t need concerts or entertainers, I just have to MAKE AMERICA GREAT AGAIN!!!" Trump posted on Truth Social.

title: Trump's says world leaders will walk all over Kamala in attack seen as denigrating women
content: Former US President Donald Trump sparked controversy by saying world leaders would treat Kamala Harris as a 'playtoy' if she became President. Trump criticized Harris, describing her as 'weak, dishonest, and dangerously liberal.' His comments came despite Harris leading among women voters. Trump's remarks drew backlash for their sexist tone, raising debates about gender in politics.
summary: Former US President Donald Trump sparked controversy by saying world leaders would treat Kamala Harris as a 'playtoy' if she became President. Trump criticized Harris, describing her as 'weak, dishonest, and dangerously liberal.' His comments came despite Harris leading among women voters. Trump's remarks drew backlash for their sexist tone, raising debates about gender in politics.

title: Did Kamala Harris ask her staff to stand and say 'Good Morning, General'?
content: Vice president Kamala Harris has been accused of antagonizing her staff resulting in an "extraordinary high" exodus rate from her office. Her ex-employees called her a tyrannical boss who terrified and cursed her employees. An account claims Kamala Harris discouraged direct eye contact and made her employees stand in attention when she entered a room. Former House speaker Kevin McCarthy told Fox News that nobody lasts very long working for Kamala Harris.
summary: Vice president Kamala Harris has been accused of antagonizing her staff resulting in an "extraordinary high" exodus rate from her office. Her ex-employees called her a tyrannical boss who terrified and cursed her employees. An account claims Kamala Harris discouraged direct eye contact and made her employees stand in attention when she entered a room. Former House speaker Kevin McCarthy told Fox News that nobody lasts very long working for Kamala Harris.

title: Myanmar junta extends emergency rule, blames 'terrorist acts'
content: Myanmar's military government extended its state of emergency by six months amidst ongoing fighting and economic challenges. The junta cited the need for additional time to prepare voter lists for a promised 2025 election. The military originally declared the emergency after a February 2021 coup, resulting in a violent crackdown on widespread protests.
summary: Myanmar's military government extended its state of emergency by six months amidst ongoing fighting and economic challenges. The junta cited the need for additional time to prepare voter lists for a promised 2025 election. The military originally declared the emergency after a February 2021 coup, resulting in a violent crackdown on widespread protests.

Germany: Alcohol-free beer sales double in past decade
content: Germany's non-alcoholic beer production has doubled in ten years, reaching 556 million liters in 2023, according to a Destatis report. Sales of low-alcohol drinks like Radler also rose. Despite the trends, alcoholic beer remains dominant. Breweries are challenged by inflation, with a notable increase in beer prices from 2022 to 2023.
summary: Germany's non-alcoholic beer production has doubled in ten years, reaching 556 million liters in 2023, according to a Destatis report. Sales of low-alcohol drinks like Radler also rose. Despite the trends, alcoholic beer remains dominant. Breweries are challenged by inflation, with a notable increase in beer prices from 2022 to 2023.

title: Dazzling Auroras possible as geomagnetic storms likely to hit earth
content: NOAA's Space Weather Prediction Center issued a geomagnetic storm warning for July 30 to August 1 after intense solar activity. Auroras could be visible in mid-latitudes. This warning stemmed from multiple M-class solar flares and CMEs, suggesting potential G3 conditions. Periods of G2 are also anticipated. The first CME impacted Earth's magnetic field on July 29, initiating a minor storm.
summary: NOAA's Space Weather Prediction Center issued a geomagnetic storm warning for July 30 to August 1 after intense solar activity. Auroras could be visible in mid-latitudes. This warning stemmed from multiple M-class solar flares and CMEs, suggesting potential G3 conditions. Periods of G2 are also anticipated. The first CME impacted Earth's magnetic field on July 29, initiating a minor storm.

Ground cinnamon recalled in US due to elevated levels of lead
content: Federal health authorities have urged consumers to check their spice racks for ground cinnamon products due to elevated lead levels. The FDA recommended recalls for nine brands, warning prolonged exposure could cause serious health issues. Several companies, including American Spices and Advance Food International, have issued recalls for affected products. Consumers are advised to seek refunds.
summary: Federal health authorities have urged consumers to check their spice racks for ground cinnamon products due to elevated lead levels. The FDA recommended recalls for nine brands, warning prolonged exposure could cause serious health issues. Several companies, including American Spices and Advance Food International, have issued recalls for affected products. Consumers are advised to seek refunds.

Watch: Megan Thee Stallion campaigns for Kamala Harris, performs 'Girls in the Hood' and 'Savage'
content: Megan Thee Stallion performed at Kamala Harris' campaign event at Georgia State University in Atlanta, with the rally drawing around 10,000 attendees. The event featured performances by Megan Thee Stallion and Quavo, and Harris focused on key issues including price gouging and immigration. Harris' campaign has raised $200 million and gathered significant volunteer support ahead of the election.
summary: Megan Thee Stallion performed at Kamala Harris' campaign event at Georgia State University in Atlanta, with the rally drawing around 10,000 attendees. The event featured performances by Megan Thee Stallion and Quavo, and Harris focused on key issues including price gouging and immigration. Harris' campaign has raised $200 million and gathered significant volunteer support ahead of the election.

title: Who was Ismail Haniyeh, Hamas chief killed in Iran?
Hamas chief Ismail Haniyeh assassinated in Iran
content: Ismail Haniyeh, Hamas chief, was killed in an attack on his residence in Tehran, as announced by both Hamas and Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps. Haniyeh was in Tehran for President Masoud Pezeshkian's swearing-in. The IRGC is investigating the incident. "The cause is under investigation and will be announced soon," it added.
summary: Ismail Haniyeh, Hamas chief, was killed in an attack on his residence in Tehran, as announced by both Hamas and Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps. Haniyeh was in Tehran for President Masoud Pezeshkian's swearing-in. The IRGC is investigating the incident. "The cause is under investigation and will be announced soon," it added.

title: 'Indecent': Macron's awkward embrace with sports minister at Paris Olympics raises eyebrows
content: Photos of French President Emmanuel Macron and Sports Minister Amélie Oudéa-Castéra sharing an affectionate moment at the 2024 Paris Olympics opening ceremony have sparked online debate. The incident, highlighted by Madame Figaro magazine, drew mixed reactions, with some critics disapproving of the public display of affection.
summary: Photos of French President Emmanuel Macron and Sports Minister Amélie Oudéa-Castéra sharing an affectionate moment at the 2024 Paris Olympics opening ceremony have sparked online debate. The incident, highlighted by Madame Figaro magazine, drew mixed reactions, with some critics disapproving of the public display of affection.

title: Hundreds of China merchants join protest against Temu
content: This week, hundreds of merchants protested at the offices of PDD Holdings Inc in southern China, accusing the owner of the Temu platform of imposing unfair penalties. The suppliers, primarily small businesses selling Chinese goods to Western consumers via Temu, gathered outside the company's Guangzhou office on Monday. They held placards and chanted slogans, with some entering the offices, though they dispersed without meeting senior executives.
summary: This week, hundreds of merchants protested at the offices of PDD Holdings Inc in southern China, accusing the owner of the Temu platform of imposing unfair penalties. The suppliers, primarily small businesses selling Chinese goods to Western consumers via Temu, gathered outside the company's Guangzhou office on Monday. They held placards and chanted slogans, with some entering the offices, though they dispersed without meeting senior executives.

title: Why this Brazilian Olympic surfer's pose has gone viral
content: Gabriel Medina's incredible wave ride in Tahiti, skillfully captured by AFP's Jerome Brouillet, has become an iconic image of surfing and the 2024 Paris Olympics. The photograph showcases Medina's triumphant exit from the wave with a record Olympic score, rapidly gaining global attention and millions of shares online.
summary: Gabriel Medina's incredible wave ride in Tahiti, skillfully captured by AFP's Jerome Brouillet, has become an iconic image of surfing and the 2024 Paris Olympics. The photograph showcases Medina's triumphant exit from the wave with a record Olympic score, rapidly gaining global attention and millions of shares online.

title: Kamala Harris to hold first rally with VP pick in crucial Philadelphia, say sources
Kamala Harris unveils $50m 'Fearless' ad campaign, targeting Trump
content: US vice president Kamala Harris launched a $50 million ad campaign with a one-minute spot titled “Fearless” after consolidating support post-Biden's withdrawal and endorsement. The campaign targets key battleground states and young voters, focusing on Donald Trump's felony convictions and anti-abortion measures, aiming to close the polling gap with her rival.
summary: US vice president  Kamala Harris launched a $50 million ad campaign with a one-minute spot titled “Fearless” after consolidating support post-Biden's withdrawal and endorsement. The campaign targets key battleground states and young voters, focusing on Donald Trump's felony convictions and anti-abortion measures, aiming to close the polling gap with her rival.
